definitions: a suggestion or assumption of the existence, fact, or truth of something as a basis for reasoning, discussion, or belief

examples.text: discrepancies between empirical findings and theoretical postulations
the postulation of the existence of a lost continent

shortDefinitions: suggestion or assumption of existence, fact, or truth of something as basis for reasoning or belief

definitions: (in ecclesiastical law) a nomination or election of someone to an ecclesiastical office subject to the sanction of a higher authority.
shortDefinitions: (in ecclesiastical law) nomination or election of someone to ecclesiastical office subject to sanction of higher authority
